price: And He gave you of all that you have asked for[24]. If you try to count the blessings of Allah, you cannot count them[25]. Indeed, mankind is truly unjust and ungrateful.
arabic: وَءَاتَىٰكُم مِّن كُلِّ مَا سَأَلۡتُمُوهُۚ وَإِن تَعُدُّواْ نِعۡمَتَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحۡصُوهَآۗ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَظَلُومٞ كَفَّارٞ
footnotes:
[24] It is not only these grand favors that Allah grants people, but their prayers are also answered, be they uttered or merely wished for.
 [25] If a person were to ever try to count Allah’s blessings on him, he would never be able to count them, let alone be duly grateful for them.

version.title: English Translation - Rowwad Translation Center
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into Englsih by Rowwad Translation Center in cooperation with Islamhouse.com

meta.transliteration: waātākum min kulli mā sa-altumūhu wa-in taʿuddū niʿ'mata al-lahi lā tuḥ'ṣūhā inna al-insāna laẓalūmun kaffārun
translations: you will (be able to) count them
